question.questionA: Carpels five or ten; inner sepals not much longer than outer.
question.questionB: Carpels three; inner sepals much longer than outer.
Leaves broadly lanceolate, petiolate, not viscid.

question.questionA: Styles  elongate,  slender,  bent or abruptly curved; sepals with prominent veins.
question.questionB: Styles absent, or short and straight; sepals with inconspicuous veins.

question.questionA: All leaves opposite; all stamens fertile.
question.questionB: Upper leaves usually alternate; outer stamens sterile.

question.questionA: Annuals  to 30  cm;  leaves  elliptical, densely hairy; petals 8-12 mm, yellow unspotted.
Plants wooly; petals with orange blotch at base.
question.questionB: Plants not wooly; petals without orange blotch at the base.

question.questionA: Leaves light green, oblong or lanceolate to ovate, with stellate hairs; stipules longer than petioles.
question.questionB: Leaves dark green, ovate to cordate; stipules absent or inconspicuous.

question.questionA: Stipules absent; pedicels downward curved at the apex.
